title: Conor McGregor arrives at court to face charge he punched a man
text:
UFC fighter Conor McGregor arrives at the Criminal Courts of Justice in Dublin today

UFC fighter Conor McGregor was today remanded on continuing bail after he appeared in court after being accused of punching a man in a pub.

The 31-year-old appeared before the Criminal Courts of Justice in Dublin this morning following the alleged attack at the Marble Arch pub in the Drimnagh suburb of the city on April 6.

CCTV footage of the alleged incident, at which McGregor was promoting his brand of whisky, emerged in August.

The case has now been adjourned for three weeks following today's hearing.

McGregor, 31, is facing a single assault charge which carries a fine of €1,500 (£1,320) or a maximum prison term of six months, or both if he is convicted.

Solicitor Michael Staines asked for the case to be adjourned to November 1. McGregor is expected to either make a plea or to contest the charge on that date.

McGregor announced his retirement from mixed martial arts in March but later hinted on social media he was ready to reverse that decision.
